definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: He works as a recorder in the city court.
The clerk's lamp illumined his countenance.
sentences.chinese: 記錄員的燈光正照着他的臉。

sentences.english: A filed copy of this certificate has been forwarded to the new castle county recorder of deeds.
sentences.chinese: 此證明書的存檔件已轉發給紐卡斯爾縣契約記錄員。

sentences.english: Do we need to co-ordinate with the ward clerk?
sentences.chinese: 我們需要和支會記錄員協調嗎？

sentences.english: One recorder should make a complete record of all decisions taken by the RO.
sentences.chinese: 要有一個記錄員將總裁判長的所有決策記錄下來。

sentences.english: Shall it be the duty of the scorekeeper to operate the alternating possession arrow?
sentences.chinese: 管理交替擁有箭號方向是記錄員的職責嗎？

sentences.english: We did not feel like mere spectators, or listeners, or recorders.
sentences.chinese: 我們不想僅僅充當旁觀着，聽衆，或記錄員。

sentences.english: Usually the minute-taker only plays a supporting role in the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 會議記錄員在會議上通常只是配角。

sentences.english: To appoint a recorder for the collective bargaining from people other than the bargaining representatives through consultation.
sentences.chinese: 協商確定一名非協商代表擔任集體協商記錄員。
